translation.en: [woman 1 in Norwegian] I know it's Christmas, but you don't get into the holiday spirit when it's sunny.
translation.it: So che è Natale, ma non si entra nello spirito natalizio se c'è il sole.

translation.en: -I need to get home to Norway. -[woman 2 on phone] Yeah.
-I'm so excited. -[woman 2] There's so much to do.
translation.it: - Non vedo l'ora. - C'è tanto da fare.

translation.en: -It's okay, Mom. You've got time. -[mom] Yes, but still…
translation.it: - Tranquilla, mamma, hai tempo. - Sì, però…

translation.en: Has it been snowing a lot? [mom] Sure, but tell me about your boyfriend!
translation.it: - Ha nevicato molto? - Certo, ma parlami del tuo ragazzo!

translation.en: Well, you can meet him if you come to visit us.
translation.it: Lo conoscerai se verrai a trovarci.

translation.en: We're settling in nicely. We're doing very well.
translation.it: Ci stiamo sistemando. Va tutto alla grande.

translation.en: Herregud? [in English] Is that a good thing?
I know you love Christmas, so I wanted to do something Christmas-themed for the…
translation.it: So che ami il Natale, quindi volevo usare un tema natalizio per…

translation.en: And I know this might be early for Norwegian standards,
translation.it: E so che potrebbe essere presto per gli standard norvegesi,

translation.en: but, in India, we would have had two kids already
translation.it: E so che potrebbe essere presto per gli standard norvegesi, ma in India avremmo già avuto due figli al college.

translation.en: and they would be in college.
translation.it: ma in India avremmo già avuto due figli al college.

translation.en: So, if you're not, like, doing anything for the next couple of decades…
translation.it: Quindi, se non hai da fare per i prossimi due decenni…

translation.en: You don't even know my middle name. [laughs]
translation.it: Non conosci il mio secondo nome.

translation.en: And did you actually also know
that I have diabetes running in my family and that's…
translation.it: del diabete nella mia famiglia e che…

translation.en: You haven't even met my family yet.
translation.it: Non conosci ancora la mia famiglia.

translation.en: But when you know, you know.
translation.it: Ma quando lo capisci, lo capisci.

translation.en: Look, the rules say you have to say yes or no.
translation.it: Secondo la regola devi dire sì o no.

translation.en: to… joining me and my family for Christmas in Norway this year?
translation.it: …di unirti a me e alla mia famiglia per un Natale in Norvegia quest'anno?

translation.en: [sighs] I would love to, but it's like you don't know my middle name.
translation.it: Mi piacerebbe, ma non conosci il mio secondo nome, quindi…

translation.en: -[man] Yes. Of course. I would love to. -Yeah?
translation.it: - Sì. Certo che mi piacerebbe. - Sì?

translation.en: Oh, you have so much to look forward to.
-Christmas in Norway is… is the best. -Mm-hmm.
translation.it: Il Natale in Norvegia è stupendo.

translation.en: You know, I'm so excited to meet your mom, Anne-Lise, and the rest of the family.
translation.it: Non vedo l'ora di conoscere tua madre, Anne-Lise, e il resto della famiglia.

translation.en: I'm gonna tell them to have a god jul.
-So my family doesn't really know that-- -Is it jool or jul?
translation.it: - La mia famiglia non sa che… - È jool o jul?

translation.en: -Uh, jul. Yeah, it's jul. Yeah. -Jul? Okay, jul.
translation.it: - Jul. Sì, è jul. - Jul? Ok, jul.

translation.en: Uh, my family doesn't really know…
[man in Norwegian] Ladies and gentlemen, we're landing at Oslo Airport.
translation.it: Signore e signori, stiamo per atterrare all'aeroporto di Oslo.

translation.en: Please fasten your seat belt and make sure the trays…
translation.it: Vi preghiamo di allacciare le cinture e assicurarvi che i vassoi…

translation.en: [in English] Sorry. What were you saying?
is super excited to see you.
You think this is fresh air? [laughs]
Are you gonna be like this the whole time?
It's just a family sweater tradition thing that we've been doing forever.
translation.it: È una tradizione di famiglia che seguiamo da sempre.

translation.en: I'm sure my mom has knitted one for you too.
translation.it: Mia madre te ne avrà fatto uno.

translation.en: Oh, I should have got them something. Oh, like the Indian equivalent of a family sweater.
translation.it: Dovevo portare qualcosa. L'equivalente indiano di un maglione così.

translation.en: You know what I was trying to tell you earlier.
translation.it: Prima ti stavo dicendo una cosa.

translation.en: -Um, I haven't-- -[driver] So, you're from India?
Uh, yeah, dude. Have you ever been?
translation.it: Sì, amico. Ci sei mai stato?

translation.en: No, I've never been to India. But I've been to Turkey. [in Norwegian] A boys' trip.
translation.it: No, mai, ma sono stato in Turchia. Un viaggio di soli uomini.

translation.en: I think my nostril hair froze to each other.
translation.it: Ho i peli delle narici congelati.

translation.en: [Anne-Lise] So good to see you, Thea.
[in English] Hello, Josh, and welcome to Norway.
-Yes, I can see that. Yes. -[Jashan laughs]
Oh, this is so nice to finally meet you, Shazam.
Oh, wow. Your home is beautiful.
-[Jashan in English] Oh, look at this. -Yes, yes.
Okay, now, this, this is Christmas.
Oh, sorry. It's, uh… It's, uh, Jashan.
-It's fine. You'll get it. -Yeah, but it was--
Yeah. So that's like this tradition that we had,
making all these Christmas decorations every year.
translation.it: di creare tutte le decorazioni ogni Natale.

translation.en: And when did you make this? [laughs]
It's all wonky and messed up. It's so sweet.
translation.it: È tutto traballante e buffo, è così dolce.

translation.en: My husband made this the last year before he died.
translation.it: L'ha fatto mio marito, l'anno prima di morire.

translation.en: Yeah, he… he really loved Christmas.
Who's a good boy? Who's a-- -[Balder growls]
-[in Norwegian] What's up with Balder? -Well, sometimes he reacts to…
translation.it: - Che succede a Balder? - Beh, a volte reagisce così a…

translation.en: [hesitatingly] To… people who are so unfamiliar.
[in Norwegian] It's very nice that you made some, but I think…
translation.it: È bello che tu l'abbia fatto, ma credo…

translation.en: -We're tired and ate on the plane. -[Anne-Lise] Yeah.
translation.it: - Siamo stanchi e abbiamo già mangiato. - Ok.

translation.en: I think we're gonna go to bed.
-[Thea] Yeah. I know. -Look at your earrings.
translation.it: - Sì, lo so. - Guarda che orecchini.

translation.en: And this is just a year after.
-But this is like a different person. -Yeah, but it's a posh period.
translation.it: - Ma sembri un'altra persona. - Il mio periodo da snob.

translation.en: Oh, and, uh, who's this dude?
[in English] Well, uh… [inhales, smacks lips] Uh, good night, mamma.
Sorry. Isn't that what you say in, uh, Norwegian? Mamma?
translation.it: Mi scusi. Non dite "mamma" in norvegese?

translation.en: You… You don't have to call me that.
Oh, no. In India, your in-laws are like your parents.
translation.it: In India, i suoceri sono come i genitori.

translation.en: So that's why I'm actually very happy to call you mamma.
translation.it: Ecco perché sarei felice di chiamarla mamma.

translation.en: Yes, but… but we are in… in Telemark.
Okay. Uh, what… what would you prefer that I called you?
translation.it: Ok. Come preferirebbe che la chiamassi?

translation.en: But that's so, uh… It's so impersonal.
No? Well, then, mamma it is. Goodnight, mamma.
translation.it: No? Ok, allora vada per "mamma". Buonanotte, mamma.

translation.en: Do you think, uh, she likes me?
do you think your mom likes me?
translation.it: Pensi che piaccia a tua madre?

translation.en: You didn't tell her I was Indian.
translation.it: Non le avevi detto che sono indiano.

translation.en: Yeah. So then, why not tell her?
translation.it: Già. Allora perché non gliel'hai detto?

translation.en: You know, my dad, he was like…
the one who would reason with her.
So if I told her, like, three weeks ago that we were engaged, she would…
translation.it: Se tre settimane fa le avessi detto della proposta, avrebbe…

translation.en: -Photoshop me in a family card? -[Thea scoffs]
She would sit alone in her room…
translation.it: Si sarebbe chiusa nella sua stanza…
Sulle antiche tradizioni indiane e altro.

translation.en: She would blow it totally out of proportion.
[female presenter] In India, we are often told that a daughter's place is with her in-laws.
translation.it: In India, ci dicono spesso che il posto di una figlia è con i suoceri.

translation.en: this practice is just as common in Indian cities as in the villages.
translation.it: ma in India è comune tanto nelle città quanto nei villaggi.

translation.en: -I've put on some coffee if you want. -[cup thuds on table]
translation.it: C'è dell'altro caffè, se ne vuoi.

translation.en: Have you talked to Jørgen since…
translation.it: Hai più sentito Jørgen da quando…

translation.en: [whispers] I know that it hasn't been easy for him either.
translation.it: Quest'anno è stato duro anche per lui.

translation.en: No, I'm sure it hasn't, but it was a long time ago, Mom.
translation.it: So che sarà stata dura, ma è stato tanto tempo fa, mamma.

translation.en: No, it's just a shame that it had to end like that.
translation.it: Ma è un peccato che sia finita così.
Tu e il figlio del vicino.

translation.en: All that stuff just got too complicated.
Dad and I always thought it was going to be the two of you.
translation.it: che io e papà pensavamo che vi sareste spostati.
Anche tu ti sei alzata presto.

translation.en: I'm going to get started on the rice pudding now
translation.it: Devo iniziare a preparare il pudding di riso,

translation.en: Dad always used to make it two days in advance.
translation.it: papà lo faceva sempre due giorni prima.

translation.en: You could have told me a little earlier
Is that okay to say, though? "Indian"? Is that allowed?
Yes, Mom. You can say Indian.
[Anne-Lise] Fine. But do I have to make two Christmas dinners now?
translation.it: Bene. Ma dovrò preparare due cene di Natale?

translation.en: I know that Norwegian and Indian cultures are incredibly different.
translation.it: So che le culture norvegese e indiana sono incredibilmente diverse.

translation.en: -What have you been googling now? -[Anne-Lise] I haven't been googling.
translation.it: - Cos'altro hai googlato? - Non ho googlato niente.

translation.en: There's just so much to do before Christmas.
translation.it: C'è già troppo da fare prima di Natale.

translation.en: I have to prepare the medister meatballs, and then we have to get firewood.
translation.it: Devo preparare le polpette di maiale e prendere la legna da ardere.

translation.en: Your brother gets stressed out if we don't have firewood.
translation.it: Tuo fratello si stressa se non abbiamo legna.

translation.en: And now I might have to make two Christmas dinners.
translation.it: E forse dovrò preparare due cene di Natale.

translation.en: I don't know your boyfriend, and I don't know what they eat in India for Christmas.
translation.it: Non conosco il tuo ragazzo e non so cosa mangiano in India a Natale.

translation.en: Yeah, the sun doesn't rise until ten.
Maybe we should give my mom a… a bit more time.
translation.it: Forse dovremmo dare un po' di tempo a mia madre.

translation.en: You don't wanna tell her about the engagement?
No. Yeah. Of course I want to tell her. It's just--
translation.it: No, certo che voglio dirglielo. È che…

translation.en: Do I need to ask for her permission or something?
No. No, no, no. That's not a thing here.
[Jashan] Okay, well, then we should just tell her.
No need to keep it a secret, right?
I just want the timing to be right.
When will the timing be right?
I just want her to get to know you.
see the side of you that I fell in love with.
translation.it: veda quel lato di te che io amo.

translation.en: -You want me to have sex with your mom? -[Thea laughs]
translation.it: Vuoi che faccia sesso con lei?

translation.en: Fine. I just wasn't ready for this, but, you know, if that's local tradition…
translation.it: Ok. Non me lo aspettavo, ma se è una tradizione locale…

translation.en: And then we can tell her.
It's going to be a perfect Christmas.
[Jashan] Hey, I know you told me to be myself,
translation.it: Ho capito che devo essere me stesso,

translation.en: but is there anything more I can do to connect with your brother?
translation.it: ma c'è altro per socializzare con tuo fratello?

translation.en: Like what does he like? Sports? Snow?
You're gonna be fine. He's gonna like you.

translation.it: Andrà tutto bene. Gli piacerai. Ok.

translation.en: And his wife is the fun one, right?
translation.it: Sua moglie è un tipo divertente, no?

translation.en: More… More like no during Christmas.
[Thea] No. Because she's on edge with my mom.
translation.it: No. Perché con mia madre va in ansia.

translation.en: -Yeah. It's gonna be fine. -[Jashan] It's gonna be fine.

translation.it: - Che bello vederti. - Ciao a te.

translation.en: [Thea] Merry Christmas! And look at you!
-Nice to meet you. -[Simen] Nice to meet you.
This must be Ronja. God jul, Ronja.
translation.it: Lei dev'essere Ronja. God jul, Ronja.

translation.en: [in English] Having some trouble with the chair?
-[Jashan] Stuck? Okay. Can I try? -Stuck, yeah. Sure.
-I have a black belt in car seats. -Okay.
translation.it: - Sono cintura nera di sedili delle auto. - Ok.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Am I a horrible human being if I say that I'm a little surprised?
translation.it: Sono un essere umano orribile se dico che sono un po' sorpreso?

translation.en: There are a billion Indians, so the odds of meeting one are pretty big.
translation.it: Ci sono un miliardo di indiani, non è difficile incontrarne uno.

translation.en: -I wasn't supposed to tell you yet. -What?
Are you kidding? You just met.
I'm waiting for the perfect timing.
Right. And you thought… that might be Christmas?
translation.it: Giusto. E hai pensato che potrebbe essere a Natale?

translation.en: This is going to be great!
[in English] You have to taste this.
[Thea] Brown cheese on Christmas cake is the best.
translation.it: Il formaggio marrone sulla torta di Natale è favoloso.

translation.en: [Jashan whispering] Sorry, mamma. I think I might be allergic to snow.
translation.it: Mi spiace, mamma, forse sono allergico alla neve.

translation.en: [Jashan in English] Okay. Ready? Three, two, one.
♪ All is calm, all is bright… ♪
[in English] You hang Norwegian flags on Christmas?
[in Norwegian] Don't eat the decorations, Hildegunn.
-Is it decorations? -It is decorations. [in English] I didn't know.
translation.it: - Sono decorazioni? Non lo sapevo. - Già.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Help me in the kitchen, will you? Yes, of course.
translation.it: - Vieni in cucina, ok? - Sì, certo.

translation.en: Simen, we are not supposed to eat these.
[In English] You know, even Americans don't do this. They're pretty patriotic.
translation.it: Nemmeno gli americani lo fanno, e sono piuttosto patriottici.
Sì. È solo lo stress natalizio.

translation.en: -That's a thing? -It's a thing in Norway.
What if we make dinner something special tonight? and tell them about the engagement?
translation.it: E se rendessimo speciale la cena, dicendo del fidanzamento?

translation.en: [whispering in English] Does she understand English? I don't… I don't know.
-[whispers in Norwegian] What did he say? -[chuckles]
You and your family have been sharing your culture with me,
translation.it: Avete condiviso la vostra cultura con me,

translation.en: and I thought I would share the best of Indian culture with you. Food.
translation.it: e ho pensato di ricambiare col meglio della cultura indiana: il cibo.

translation.en: Wow. Where did you get all the spices?
I bring them with me, bro. Duh.
translation.it: Le ho portate con me. Vai!

translation.en: You said let's make dinner something special.
Jashan, I said let's make dinner something special,
translation.it: Jashan, ho detto di rendere speciale la cena,

translation.en: like… Not make something special for dinner.
translation.it: non di fare qualcosa di speciale per cena.

translation.en: [sighs] I thought everyone would be busy with Christmas stuff,
and I would make dinner and surprise everyone.

translation.it: - È solo che… - È solo cosa?
- È solo che… - È solo cosa? È il 22 dicembre.

translation.en: It's, um… It's Teeny Tiny Christmas.
It's the day before the day before the big day,
translation.it: È due giorni prima del grande giorno

translation.en: and it's sort of like a big deal in our family.
translation.it: ed è importante per la nostra famiglia.

translation.en: I thought the big day was December 25th.
translation.it: Il grande giorno non è il 25?

translation.en: I told you. In Norway, it's 24th.
translation.it: Te l'ho detto, in Norvegia è il 24.

translation.en: So there's a teeny day before a tiny day before the big day,
translation.it: Quindi ci sono due piccoli giorni prima del grande giorno,

translation.en: No. Maybe I exaggerated a little.
translation.it: No, forse ho esagerato un po'.

translation.en: -What are you doing? -I don't know what I'm doing.
translation.it: - Che stai facendo? - Non lo so.
Forse non è esattamente la cena

translation.en: the dinner we're used to for Teeny Tiny Christmas.
translation.it: da Piccolissima Vigilia a cui siamo abituati.

translation.en: [in English] We always have medister cakes on Little Little Christmas.
translation.it: Alla Piccolissima Vigilia abbiamo sempre delle torte medister.

translation.en: [exhales sharply] I actually just found out about Teeny Tiny Christmas.
translation.it: In verità, ho appena saputo della Piccolissima Vigilia.

translation.en: -Yeah. But now we have curry, so… -[chuckles]
translation.it: Già. Ma ora abbiamo il curry.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] It was a tradition, though.
meatballs on Teeny Tiny Christmas, and you all really liked it.
translation.it: le polpette per la Piccolissima Vigilia, e tutti le adoravate.

translation.en: But maybe we can just give this a try?
Did you hear that? Did you hear that?
-It was just Dad turning in his grave. -[Hildegunn] Stop it.
translation.it: - Era papà che si rivoltava nella tomba. - Smettila.

translation.en: Ronja, Dad is joking. Grandpa is dead.
translation.it: Ronja, papà sta scherzando. Il nonno è morto.

translation.en: [chuckling] He hasn't risen from the dead. He is not moving at all.
translation.it: Non è risorto. Non si muove affatto.

translation.en: [breathes shakily] May God be with him.
Thank you for keeping an open mind.
translation.it: Grazie per la vostra apertura mentale.

translation.en: We've been eating meatballs every year.
[in English] Norwegians are a very accepting people.
translation.it: I norvegesi sono un popolo molto tollerante.

translation.en: I understand this is different from your normal traditions.
translation.it: Mi rendo conto che è diverso dalle vostre tradizioni.

translation.en: You've probably never had Indian food before. So--
translation.it: Forse non avete mai mangiato cibo indiano…

translation.en: [Simen and Hildegunn in Norwegian] Yes, yes.
[in English] Yeah. Maybe you can take it in English so that Jashan understands.
translation.it: Sì. Ma se parlate in inglese, magari Jashan capirà.

translation.en: -We eat Indian food. -Yeah. We love Indian food.
translation.it: - Mangiamo cibo indiano. - Sì. Adoriamo il cibo indiano.

translation.en: There's great Indian food at the Chinese restaurant in town.
translation.it: Ci sono ottimi piatti indiani al ristorante cinese in città.

translation.en: I'm sorry, did you say there was a Chinese restaurant that serves Indian food?
translation.it: Un ristorante cinese che serve piatti indiani?

translation.en: -Yeah. It's not really Indian food. It's… -[Simen] Yeah.
translation.it: Sì, non è proprio cibo indiano…

translation.en: [Simen] Yes. It's, uh… It's Indian and… and Chinese,
translation.it: Sì, c'è cibo indiano e cinese

translation.en: and… and they have a lot of Norwegian dishes. -Yes. -Uh, like pizza and hamburgers.
translation.it: e molti piatti norvegesi, come la pizza e l'hamburger.

translation.en: -And the chef… Oh! -Oh, the chef is so good.
translation.it: - E lo chef… - Lo chef è bravissimo.

translation.en: -He is good. -He is good. Yeah. You should go.
[in Norwegian] Ronja, don't you agree? They serve good food at the Chinese place.
translation.it: Ronja, sei d'accordo? Il ristorante cinese è ottimo.

translation.en: -[in English] Jashan is a good cook too. -[both chuckle]
translation.it: Anche Jashan è un bravo cuoco.

translation.en: -Mmm. Yes. -[Simen in Norwegian] It does smell.
-[in English] So please dig in. -[Hildegunn munching]
[in English] It's almost like a taco.
Shazam, since this is your, hmm, first Christmas--
translation.it: Shazam, dato che è il tuo primo Natale…

translation.en: Oh, we have Christmas in India.
translation.it: Oh, abbiamo il Natale in India.

translation.en: Oh, but I knew, but… [chuckles] Sorry. How do you usually celebrate?
translation.it: Cioè, sì… Scusami. Come festeggiate di solito?

translation.en: Well, uh, my family is not Christian,
so we do this funny thing of, like, we'll do a countdown to midnight,
translation.it: ma facciamo il conto alla rovescia fino a mezzanotte

translation.en: and then we say Merry Christmas,
translation.it: e poi ci facciamo gli auguri,

translation.en: and we get smashed and we have a lot of food, set off fireworks.
translation.it: beviamo e mangiamo un sacco, e ci sono i fuochi d'artificio.

translation.en: That sounds like New Year's here in Norway.
[Simen in Norwegian] "Sounds like"? It literally is.
And, you know, this year, I'm so happy to be here with all of you
translation.it: E quest'anno sono felice di essere qui con tutti voi

translation.en: and to get to share this part of my culture with you.
translation.it: e poter condividere questa parte della mia cultura.

translation.en: What is it? Are you okay?
-[in English] Is it that spicy? -No, it's really…
[coughing] I'm so sorry. It's very good. I just have to…
translation.it: Mi dispiace tanto. È ottimo. Devo solo…

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] I'll go with Mom. -If you have to spit it out, use this.
translation.it: - Vado con mamma. - Se devi sputare, usa questo.

translation.en: Anne-Lise doesn't want it on her rug.
translation.it: Non sputare sul tappeto di Anne-Lise.

translation.en: [in English] Yeah, just… Yeah, just… I just need to check.
[in Norwegian] You guys are being very dramatic.
-[in English] Mamma, water will not help. -[Anne-Lise] Excuse me?
It's… You need some dairy. Uh, if you have yogurt?
I don't know. I don't know. I really don't know.
translation.it: Non lo so, non ne ho idea.

translation.en: -Don't take the pudding. We need it for-- -Mom, come on! We don't have a choice.
translation.it: - Non il pudding. Ci serve per… - Mamma, dai! Non abbiamo scelta.

translation.en: But Dad said it needs to stay…
translation.it: Ma papà diceva che deve restare…

translation.en: -[Simen in Norwegian] Oh, it burns. -Just go.
I think it needs more time to set.
translation.it: No, il pudding non è ancora pronto.

translation.en: [in English] How many chilies did you use?
Spice is about more than just chilies. This is super mild.
translation.it: Ho messo più spezie che peperoncini. Non è affatto piccante.

translation.en: There's a difference between Norwegian spicy and Indian spicy.
translation.it: Il piccante norvegese e quello indiano sono diversi.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I don't know if Simen told you,
translation.it: Non so se Simen ti ha detto

translation.en: but I lived in India for a couple of months after high school.
translation.it: che ho vissuto due mesi in India dopo il liceo.

translation.en: [in English] Okay. Hildegunn, she… she… she… lived in India for several months.
translation.it: Hildegunn ha vissuto in India per qualche mese.

translation.en: -Oh! Oh, cool. That is cool. -[Hildegunn chuckles]
I actually… [chuckles] I wanted to show you this.
What is it? Don't you like it?

translation.it: Sì? Dai, di che si tratta?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] It doesn't matter what it means, does it?
translation.it: Non importa cosa c'è scritto, no?

translation.en: Thea, it is important because it's a tattoo.
translation.it: Thea, sì che importa, perché è un tatuaggio.

translation.en: It's cut into my body until I die.
translation.it: Resterà sul mio corpo fino alla morte.

translation.en: I want to know what it says.
[in English] Hypothetically speaking, it might say gori.
translation.it: In pura teoria, potrebbe significare gori.

translation.en: That doesn't sound so bad. [chuckles] What… What does that mean?
translation.it: Non sembra una brutta parola. Cosa significa?

translation.en: White girl, that's… [inhales shakily] …exactly what I am.
translation.it: Beh, è esattamente ciò che sono.

translation.en: I'm just gonna go help the others. Yeah.
I think your "poopadoonk" was a little bit dry, by the way.
translation.it: Comunque il tuo "poopadoonk" era un po' asciutto.

translation.en: Maybe tomorrow we can try to do Christmas the Norwegian way?
translation.it: Magari domani possiamo provare a fare un Natale alla norvegese?

translation.en: [Anne-Lise] "Out on a hike, what's not to like?"
translation.it: "In giro sulla neve, che vuoi di più?"

translation.en: [Simen] Out on a hike, what's not to…
[Jashan in English] Wow. How's she doing that?
In Norway we say that Norwegians are born with skis on their feet.
translation.it: Si dice che i norvegesi nascono con gli sci ai piedi.

translation.en: Yeah? Sounds like a painful childbirth.
No. [in Norwegian] Out on a hike, what's not to like?
translation.it: No. In giro sulla neve, che vuoi di più?

translation.en: -Okay. Come on. I can help you. -[Jashan panting]
We have this lunch place just on the other side of the hill.
translation.it: C'è un posto per mangiare dall'altra parte della collina.
- Ti piace l'idea? - Oh, sì. Si mangia.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Come on! Go, go, go!
[Jashan in English] Okay. So… So, what kind of food do they serve?
translation.it: Cosa si mangia da queste parti?

translation.en: So this is what we would call koselig in Norway.
translation.it: Questo è ciò che definiamo koselig in Norvegia.

translation.en: No. It's just that when you said there was a lunch place,
translation.it: Niente, ma quando hai detto che c'era un posto per mangiare,

translation.en: you know, in my head, I thought there was gonna be…
translation.it: nella mia testa ho pensato che ci sarebbe stato…

translation.en: Yeah. No, that would be crazy if there was a restaurant.
translation.it: Sì. Sarebbe assurdo se qui ci fosse un ristorante.

translation.en: [Anne-Lise] So, what do you guys think?
Maybe you should go in advance?
So we can ski at our tempo, so he doesn't feel…
translation.it: Noi scieremo al nostro ritmo, così lui non si sentirà…

translation.en: I know, but it's a bit different.
translation.it: Lo so, ma oggi è un po' diverso.

translation.en: But we're supposed to make gingerbread cookies together.
Can't we make gingerbread cookies some other time?
Of course! We can move the gingerbread cookie making to Easter.
translation.it: Certo! Possiamo spostare i biscotti al pan di zenzero a Pasqua.

translation.en: -I need to pack the rucksack. -[Hildegunn] Take this…
Uh… We… The two of us can go together.
-Yeah. It's called koselig, right? -[Thea] We're home soon. I promise.
translation.it: Sì. Si dice koselig, no? Siamo quasi arrivati.

translation.en: We just need to go down to Oksetjønn and take a left to Skjerdalen.
translation.it: Dobbiamo andare a Oksetjønn e girare per Skjerdalen.

translation.en: Those names mean nothing. You're making them up.
-[sighs] -[Jashan] I won't do it. Leave me here.
Have you ever done this before?
My dad used to do it with me.
translation.it: Mio padre lo faceva con me.

translation.en: Do you want me to ask Simen to look for them?
translation.it: Vuoi che chieda a Simen di cercarli?

translation.en: No, let him relax. He's put on his comfy joggers…
translation.it: No, lascialo rilassare. Ha messo i suoi pantaloni comodi,

translation.en: with a glass of Christmas soda in his hand,
getting into the spirit with Die Hard.
translation.it: e sta guardando il classico Die Hard.

translation.en: [Thea] It's just difficult without my dad.
And every year is just a reminder of what we lost.
translation.it: Ogni anno ci ricordiamo di ciò che abbiamo perso.

translation.en: And I really want them to like you
translation.it: E voglio che tu piaccia a loro,

translation.en: You know, in Norway, we call this koselig.
translation.it: Sai, un momento così in Norvegia lo chiamiamo koselig.

translation.en: [in English] You guys know each other?
That's crazy. What a small country.
[in Norwegian] Are you going somewhere? What are you doing here?
translation.it: Vai da qualche parte? Che ci fai qui?

translation.en: -[Jashan in English] Hey. -I'm just telling him that we're not lost.
translation.it: - Ehi. - Gli sto dicendo che non ci siamo persi.

translation.en: We're not lost. We're just going to "Oksischen" and "Shellbraider."
translation.it: Non ci siamo persi. Passeremo da "Oksischen" e "Shellbraider".
- Già. - Sì, è tutto a posto.

translation.en: You sure you don't want a ride?
-Dude, we would love a ride. -Yes. We're fine.
I'm not gonna ski back. Yes, we would love a ride.
translation.it: Non voglio sciare. Un passaggio sarebbe fantastico.

translation.en: -[Jørgen] Okay. -Thank you so much. That's amazing.
[gasps] Oh, dude, can I sit in the carriage? [Jørgen] Let me take the skis.
translation.it: - Posso sedermi sul traino? - Dammi gli sci.

translation.en: [in English] Oh, God bless you, Jørgen.
Dude, we're making something called "pepper cakes." You wanna come inside?
translation.it: Amico, stiamo facendo dei biscotti. Vuoi entrare?

translation.en: What do you mean, dude? You saved my life.
translation.it: Cosa? Mi hai salvato la vita.

translation.en: Come on. Come inside. We'll have a drink or something.
It might be a bit weird.
Why would it be weird? What? You guys used to hook up or something?
translation.it: Cioè? Voi due stavate insieme o cose del genere?
Sì, siamo stati insieme cinque anni.

translation.en: Didn't really… get to that part.
translation.it: La cosa non era così importante.

translation.en: No, we just live together. We don't talk about stuff. [chuckles]
translation.it: No, viviamo insieme, non parliamo fra noi.

translation.en: Oh, hey, see you around, dude.
[in English] So that's the guy from the picture in the stairway.
translation.it: Quindi è lui il tizio nella foto sulle scale.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Don't you think you should get a new apron?
I've always had it. Lasse gave it to me when we were…
translation.it: L'ho sempre avuto. Me l'ha dato Lasse quando eravamo…

translation.en: So you thought it was a good idea to call my ex?
translation.it: Hai ritenuto una buona idea chiamare il mio ex?

translation.en: I was worried about you two. I got scared.
translation.it: Ero preoccupata per voi due. Mi sono spaventata.

translation.en: Mom, that is a very weird thing to do.
translation.it: Mamma, è una cosa molto strana da fare.

translation.en: Remember that before he was your ex, he was the kid next door.
translation.it: Prima di essere il tuo ex era il ragazzo della porta accanto.

translation.en: So if you think it's weird, it's because you're making it weird.
translation.it: Se ti sembra strano, è perché lo rendi tu strano.

translation.en: Yeah. I just can't figure out this house.
translation.it: Sì. Non so come montare la casetta.

translation.en: But I'm happy to be inside.
translation.it: Ma sono felice di essere al chiuso.

translation.en: It would have been nice to get some heads-up that your ex lives next door.
translation.it: Sarebbe stato bello avvisarmi che il tuo ex vive accanto.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I almost forgot. When are we doing our Christmas dip tomorrow?
translation.it: Dimenticavo, quando facciamo il bagno di Natale, domani?

translation.en: Can't we just do it when we wake up?
-[in English] Are you going to the… -Ah, you bet, Simen.
translation.it: Vuoi fare il… Certo, Simen. Sono qui per vivere l'esperienza del Natale norvegese.

translation.en: I am here for the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
translation.it: Certo, Simen. Sono qui per vivere l'esperienza del Natale norvegese.

translation.en: No, Jashan, you don't really need to do that.
translation.it: No, Jashan, non sei tenuto a farlo.

translation.en: Oh, that's nice that you're joining us for isbading.
translation.it: Che bello che tu ti unisca a noi per l'isbading.

translation.en: I am very happy to join you for… what?
translation.it: Sono felice di unirmi a voi per… cosa?
- Fa bene. - Come può fare bene?

translation.en: You said you wanted the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
Yeah, but that was before I knew you guys were crazy.
translation.it: Prima di sapere che eravate pazzi.

translation.en: Isn't it a bit too cold for him?
translation.it: Non è troppo freddo per lui?

translation.en: -Uh… -[in English] It's a bit too cold for you.
Oh, no, no. I was just actually warming up before I went in.
translation.it: Oh, no. Mi sto solo scaldando prima di tuffarmi.

translation.en: -[Jørgen] You must be cold. [laughs] -[Anne-Lise] Not at all.
It's so nice that you came.
translation.it: Che bello che tu sia qui.

translation.en: Merry Christmas. This is so nice. [chuckles]
[in English] I have to admit, I hated it when these two little birds
translation.it: Devo ammettere che ho odiato quando loro due mi hanno costretto

translation.en: forced me into ice bathing for the first time. [laughs]
translation.it: a fare il primo bagno di ghiaccio.

translation.en: Well, actually, you know, no one's forcing me, so…
translation.it: In realtà, nessuno mi costringe, quindi…

translation.en: -Oh. No, no, no. Of course. -[Jashan] Yeah. Yeah.
for the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
translation.it: per vivere l'esperienza del Natale norvegese.

translation.en: Jash, you really don't have to do it. It's fine.
translation.it: Jash, non devi farlo per forza.

translation.en: [whispers in English] I didn't know you were Christian.
Why are we in a church?
And because Ronja is in the choir, and she is looking forward to her solo.
translation.it: E perché Ronja è nel coro e non vede l'ora di fare il suo assolo.

translation.en: ♪ In the soul's joyful pilgrim song ♪
[Jashan singing loudly in bad accent] ♪ Angels first sang it ♪
[Jashan singing loudly in bad accent] ♪ In joy it passed ♪
[in English] Yeah, but it's too loud.
[singing quietly in bad Norwegian accent] ♪ Peace over Earth ♪
[whispers in bad accent] ♪ A savior for all time is born ♪
Before we go out into this beautiful Christmas Day,
translation.it: Prima di goderci questo splendido giorno di Natale,
noi del coro Telemark Soul Children

translation.en: wish you a Merry Christmas with this--
translation.it: vi auguriamo un buon Natale con questo…

translation.en: [in Norwegian] With this delightful Christmas classic.
You're the one who said ice bathing was a good idea.
translation.it: Per te il bagno di ghiaccio era salutare.

translation.en: -[Jashan sneezes, sniffles] -♪ Round yon Virgin Mother and Child ♪
translation.it: Tu che i vati da lungi sognar

translation.en: ♪ Holy infant so tender and mild ♪
Fine. I'll go out in the cold.
translation.it: Va bene. Starò un po' al freddo.

translation.en: [Jashan] I'm sure freezing temperature will help.
translation.it: Un bel congelamento mi aiuterà di sicuro.

translation.en: Can you hear me? Hello. Hi.
They just come to church for Christmas.
translation.it: Vanno in chiesa solo a Natale.

translation.en: They do weird things, and when I ask why, it's just tradition.
translation.it: Fanno cose strane. Se chiedo perché, è solo per tradizione.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Thea, can you please stop your boyfriend?
translation.it: Thea, puoi fermare il tuo ragazzo?

translation.en: [Jashan in Hindi] They do weird things all the time.
translation.it: Fanno stranezze e, se gli chiedi perché, dicono

translation.en: If you ask why, "That's just how it is…"
[whispering in English] How do you say, "I'm sorry, Ronja"?
I'm not talking about the church.
I thought it'd be fun to bring my loudest kurta to a Christmas party but…
translation.it: Pensavo che sarebbe stato divertente usare il mio kurta più sgargiante, ma…

translation.en: -Uh, can you help me with this? -[Jashan] Sure.
-Okay. So you just want it to kind of go… -[Jashan sniffles]
Sorry. I just… It's… Yeah, just try again.
Like I needed more proof I didn't fit in here. [sniffles]
translation.it: Un'altra prova del fatto che sono fuori luogo.
Jash, non sei fuori luogo. Ok?

translation.en: It's like, you can't really wear jewelry
Something called bunad police. It's like a traditional thing.
translation.it: Viene detta "polizia del bunad". È una tradizione.

translation.en: You know what? I'll just go and ask my mom.
translation.it: Sai cosa? Chiedo una mano a mia madre.

translation.en: Jashan is sorry for ruining your moment in church.
translation.it: A Jashan dispiace averti rovinato il canto.

translation.en: There's not much left for him to ruin now.
translation.it: Non gli resta molto da rovinare.

translation.en: We've been through all the crazy stuff leading up to Christmas.
translation.it: Abbiamo affrontato tutte le follie prenatalizie.

translation.en: Hot dog on the grill, um, church, not to mention Christmas bathing.
translation.it: Gli hot dog alla griglia, la chiesa e persino il bagno di Natale.

translation.en: Don't call it Christmas bathing. It makes it sound fun.
translation.it: Se lo chiami così sembra divertente.
resta solo la cena di Natale.

translation.en: We eat some cookies. We, uh, open presents.
translation.it: Mangeremo biscotti e apriremo i regali.

translation.en: And by the end of the night,
I think we should tell them. We should break the news about our engagement.
translation.it: dovremmo dirglielo. Dovremmo dare la notizia del nostro fidanzamento.

translation.en: -All right. Yeah. We're telling them. -[Thea] Okay.
-[Anne-Lise in Norwegian] Do you like it? -Great crispy pork crackling, Mom.
translation.it: Ti piace? Il maiale è ottimo, mamma.

translation.en: Oh no. Maybe you… you can't eat pig.
translation.it: Oh, no. Forse non puoi mangiare maiale.

translation.en: Uh, I'm Hindu. Muslims don't eat pork.
translation.it: Sono indù. I musulmani non lo mangiano.

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] Yes, of course. -Yes. I remember now.
[in Norwegian] Ronja, you have to eat your food, not just move it around.
translation.it: Ronja, devi mangiare il cibo e non spostarlo nel piatto.

translation.en: Grandma has spent so much time making it. You have to taste it. [chuckles]
translation.it: La nonna ci ha messo tanto a prepararlo. Devi assaggiarlo.

translation.en: Sauce. Yes. What sauce is this?
translation.it: La salsa. Sì. Che salsa è?

translation.en: -You have to have it. -It's very good.
[Simen in Norwegian] Otherwise, it'll be too dry.
And what kind of fat is this?
translation.it: Di che altro grasso si tratta?

translation.en: Oh, no, no. It's not fat.
translation.it: Oh, no. Quello non è grasso.

translation.en: You know, it's the potato booze I was telling you about?
translation.it: Ricordi l'alcolico di patate di cui ti parlavo?

translation.en: -This does help. -[Thea] Mm-hmm. -Can I have some more? -[Thea] Yeah.
translation.it: - Aiuta eccome. Posso averne ancora? - Sì.

translation.en: Yeah. But you don't need to do the whole shot.
translation.it: Sì, ma non è il caso di berne troppo.

translation.en: I don't think that's so smart, but…
-Uh, do you want… -No. No. I'm not drinking.
[whispers] How am I supposed to finish this?
translation.it: Come farò a finire il piatto?

translation.en: [in Hindi] Now this is more like it!
[in English] I'm so glad you liked it.
[Jashan] Hindu is a Norwegian spice brand?
translation.it: "Hindu" è una marca norvegese di spezie?

translation.en: …as an Indian person, I never thought I would be offended by spices.
translation.it: Scusate ma da indiano non avrei mai pensato di venire offeso dalle spezie.
- Sì. - Ma queste sono delle spezie razziste…

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Has he been seasoning my pork with garlic powder and piri-piri?
translation.it: Ha condito il mio maiale con aglio in polvere e piri-piri?

translation.en: [in English] I mean, come on. No disrespect, but I use an entire garlic to fry an egg.
translation.it: Senza mancare di rispetto, ma io uso un aglio intero per un uovo fritto.

translation.en: …unseasoned pork with crunchy fat and chewy fat and fat sauce.
translation.it: …mangiare maiale non condito, con contorni di grassi vari?

translation.en: Why do you have Black Boy and Hindu spices in your house?
translation.it: Perché avete in casa le spezie Black Boy e Hindu?

translation.en: Well, if he doesn't like it, then I'm sure we have a lot of curries that Shazam--
translation.it: Se non gli piace, c'è un sacco di curry che Shazam…

translation.en: Okay? Not Shazam. Not Sasham. It's Jashan.
translation.it: Né Shazam né Sasham, ma Jashan.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I'll go and get some more sausages.
[whispering in English] Can you please just try to fit in?
[softly] Like Hildegunn who pretends like she has no personality so she can fit into your Norwegian Christmas cult.
translation.it: Finge di non avere personalità per entrare nella vostra setta natalizia.

translation.en: Yeah. Christmas cult, with your crazy uniforms and your weird rituals.
translation.it: Sì. È una setta natalizia con uniformi strane e rituali bizzarri.

translation.en: I'm not asking you to dye your hair blond or to speak Norwegian.
translation.it: Non ti sto chiedendo di tingerti i capelli di biondo o di parlare norvegese.

translation.en: -[doorbell rings] -I just want my family to be happy for us.
translation.it: Voglio che siano felici per noi.

translation.en: Why would they be happy for us if you force me to eat pork fat?
translation.it: Lo sarebbero costringendomi a mangiare grasso di maiale?

translation.en: So is baby tossing and human sacrifice and stoning.
translation.it: Come i lanci di bambini, i sacrifici umani e la lapidazione.

translation.en: Just because it's tradition doesn't mean it's good.
translation.it: Come i lanci di bambini, i sacrifici umani e la lapidazione. Non tutte le tradizioni sono buone.

translation.en: [in English] Can we please talk about this later? No, I am upset now.
translation.it: - Possiamo parlarne dopo? - No, sono arrabbiato ora.

translation.en: And is that the answer for everything?
translation.it: Ed è la tua risposta a tutto?

translation.en: Why do atheists go to church? It's Christmas.
translation.it: Atei che vanno in chiesa? È Natale.

translation.en: Why do we swim in ice water? It's Christmas.
Why do we hide our feelings? It's Christmas.
[Anne-Lise in Norwegian] Thea, Santa is here!
What does it say on this one?
-[in Norwegian] Come on, Aunt Thea. -You must come and get your present.
translation.it: - Forza, zia Thea. - Vieni a prendere il tuo regalo.

translation.en: Maybe you want to sit on Santa's lap?
translation.it: Vuoi sederti sulle ginocchia di Babbo Natale?

translation.en: -You have to sit. -Yes, you have to sit.
[Jørgen] There we go. This is cozy.
translation.it: Ecco qua, ora sì che va bene.

translation.en: Have you been a good girl this year, Aunt Thea?
translation.it: Hai fatto la brava quest'anno, zia Thea?

translation.en: [in English] I'm sorry. Am I the only one who finds this weird?
translation.it: Scusate, ma sono l'unico a trovarlo assurdo?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Maybe someone is upset he's not getting a present from Santa this year?
translation.it: Qualcuno è arrabbiato perché non riceverà un regalo da Babbo Natale?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Well, it's getting late, little Ronja.
translation.it: Beh, si è fatto tardi, piccola Ronja.
Rudolph è qui fuori ad aspettarmi

translation.en: and the night is still young.
translation.it: e la notte è ancora giovane.

translation.en: -[in English] Yeah. -What the fuck, man? Don't push me.
I think Santa should get going. [sighs]
translation.it: Credo che sia ora di andare.
Ciao a tutti e buon Natale.

translation.en: Because you don't fit in to this Christmas cult?
translation.it: Perché non appartieni a questa setta natalizia?

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] Let's bring the candy to… -[Jashan sighs]
-[Simen] I'm gonna chop some wood. -[Anne-Lise] I'll start the dishes.
translation.it: - Taglio un po' di legna. - Io lavo i piatti.

translation.en: [in English] Do you think that's what it's about?
I knew it would be difficult to fit in with your family,
translation.it: Sapevo che sarebbe stato difficile adattarmi ai tuoi

translation.en: and I knew it would be difficult to fit in with your traditions.
And if you came to India, you would have a hard time fitting in too.
translation.it: Se venissi in India, anche tu faresti fatica ad ambientarti.

translation.en: The difference is, I would have had your back. [exhales]
translation.it: Però io ti avrei coperto le spalle.

translation.en: Or are you someone so obsessed with making Christmas perfect that you lost sight of me?
translation.it: O sei così ossessionata dal Natale da perdermi di vista?

translation.en: Then why won't you tell your family we're engaged?
translation.it: Perché non dici che siamo fidanzati?

translation.en: I was just waiting for the right moment.
-So, listen to some music, or do you… -[Jashan] I'm okay.
translation.it: - Vuoi ascoltare un po' di musica o… - Sto bene così.

translation.en: [driver] Yes. But we can be silent. That's all. No problem.
translation.it: Possiamo anche non parlare. Nessun problema.

translation.en: [Thea in Norwegian] Look at the nice colors.
No. You can't be sad on Christmas Eve.
translation.it: No, non si è mai tristi la vigilia di Natale.

translation.en: There are many presents left, Ronja. Why don't you go get one more?
translation.it: Ci sono ancora tanti regali, Ronja. Perché non ne prendi un altro?

translation.en: [voice breaks] He is actually really cool.
It was just Jørgen who was pretending because he is in love with you.
translation.it: Era Jørgen. Si è camuffato perché è innamorato di te.

translation.en: I don't think he's actually in love. [sniffles]
But Jashan ruined your song in church, and you were so excited about it.
translation.it: Ma Jashan ha rovinato la tua canzone in chiesa, e tu ne eri così entusiasta.

translation.en: Not really. I just sang because Mom says that Grandma wants me to.
translation.it: Per niente. Ho cantato solo perché mamma dice che lo vuole nonna.

translation.en: I like it when the children sing.
translation.it: Mi piace sentire cantare i bambini.

translation.en: I was thinking. Your bunad is so beautiful.
translation.it: Stavo pensando che è davvero un bel bunad.

translation.en: -I don't give a shit. -You can't say "shit."
translation.it: - Non me ne frega. - Non si dice così.

translation.en: No, I'm not sure, Mom. I'm not.
translation.it: Non ne sono sicura, mamma. No.

translation.en: I just can't listen to you right now.
And I know you think that my relationship with Jashan is just a phase
translation.it: E so che pensi che il mio rapporto con Jashan sia solo una fase,

translation.en: because I've messed around so much.
translation.it: perché ho fatto tanti casini finora.

translation.en: [whispers] Maybe you should go and play with your Christmas gifts.
translation.it: Vai a giocare coi tuoi regali di Natale.

translation.en: I've just tried to make everything right this Christmas
translation.it: Volevo che questo Natale andasse alla grande,

translation.en: because I know it's important to you and because
translation.it: perché so che è importante per te e perché

translation.en: I wanted to do it like we always did it with Dad
translation.it: volevo che fosse com'era con papà.

translation.en: to help Jashan fit in and… [sobs]
And to make you like him.
But it's not mine or Jashan's job to make you like him.
translation.it: Ma non sta né a me né a lui che Jashan vi piaccia.

translation.en: [sniffles] This was supposed to be happy news,
but I might as well say it now since everyone is in such great spirits.
translation.it: e ve la darò ora, dato che siamo di ottimo umore.

translation.en: Pretty stupid to throw him out on Christmas Eve, then.
translation.it: Un po' stupido cacciarlo proprio oggi.

translation.en: I thought my life was perfect.
translation.it: pensavo che la mia vita fosse perfetta!

translation.en: You were supposed to live in the house next door,
and your kids were supposed to come to our house to do homework
translation.it: e i tuoi figli sarebbero venuti da noi a fare i compiti

translation.en: I'm the one who should say sorry.
I'm just afraid to lose you.
There is a reason you don't drink alcohol on Christmas Eve.
translation.it: Ecco perché è meglio non bere a Natale.

translation.en: You didn't all have to come with me.
Of course we had to come. We all have to apologize.
translation.it: Certo che dovevamo farlo, dobbiamo scusarci tutti.

translation.en: Can we please slow down a bit?
We are on our way to the airport on Christmas Eve.
We're getting her fiancé. This is the most romantic thing I've ever experienced.
translation.it: Con la sua fidanzata. È la cosa più romantica della mia vita.

translation.en: -Shut up, please. -Saying shut up is not allowed.
translation.it: - Ora stai zitto. - Non si dice così.

translation.en: Your mom is allowed to say shut up.
We're not going to make it.
Of course we're going to make it.
And you were totally right about everything you said
about me not having your back.
translation.it: che non ti ho coperto le spalle.

translation.en: I'm sorry I didn't tell them about the engagement.
translation.it: Scusa se non ho detto del fidanzamento.

translation.en: I just… I don't know. I thought it would be easier that way.
translation.it: È che… Pensavo che così fosse più facile.

translation.en: How… How did you get inside the airport?

translation.en: Thank you very much, man, but it was all her idea.
translation.it: Grazie mille, ma l'idea è stata sua.
